thread.title: Back To The Future's self-tying shoes are actually here - and Michael J. Fox has a pair
thread.title_full: Back To The Future's self-tying shoes are actually here - and Michael J. Fox has a pair

title: Back To The Future's self-tying shoes are actually here - and Michael J. Fox has a pair
text:
Back To The Future's self-tying shoes are actually here - and Michael J. Fox has a pair Back To The Future's self-tying shoes are actually here - and Michael J. Fox has a pair 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Back To The Future fans had a very large dose of excitement this week as the day Marty McFly travelled forward to – October 21 2015 – became the present. 
And as if that wasn’t enough – Nike went and made fans’ Back To The Future Day by unveiling an ACTUAL pair of self-tying shoes, as sported by Marty in Part II of the trilogy. If you can imagine the future, you can create it.⠀⠀⠀ ⠀Find out about pair no. 1 at https://t.co/ptkErznzjl pic.twitter.com/Gi6UMNsNML 
To top it all off, Nike gave the first pair to Michael J. Fox, who played Marty in the film all those years ago. 
In a handwritten letter, legendary Nike shoe designer Tinker Hatfield teased the actor. 
The note read: “We wanted you to be the first to receive a pair… In addition to your personal pair, we’re creating more pairs for support in aid of the Foundation in 2016.” The letter I received from Tinker today. Thanks @Nike pic.twitter.com/UIolXrkUVC 
— Michael J. Fox (@realmikefox) October 21, 2015 
And true to his word – the shoes of the future materialised. This is real. This is today. Coming spring 2016. cc: @RealMikeFox @Nike pic.twitter.com/KPswXNojvA
